item.title: Ceiling tiles falling outside the lift at Timothy House, 2nd December
item.description:
These ceiling tiles have been hanging loose for some time now, I saw this when I got out of the lift this morning. This could have easily been someone's head it fell on! These tiles need appropriate fixtures and should not pose a risk to residents!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kale Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Outside Cabman’s Shelter, 2nd December
item.description:
The drain seems blocked as waste water from the Taxi Shelter runs on the pavement instead of down the drain. It has happened last year as well. After reporting the problem a team of operatives attended and pumped not the drain in question but the 2 nearest drains on the pavement as they seem to be connected underground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Russell Square, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: KEEP CLEAR markings faded, 2nd December
item.description:
Hello, I’m a Bus Driver and the KEEP CLEAR Road Markings (see pic) as you’re going around The Ridgeway along Lewisham High Street have faded, thus vehicles are blocking Buses exit and causing delays. Please can they be repainted? Regards Chris Baker

item.title: Enfield council discrimination, 2nd December
item.description:
We are now at the point in Winchmore Hill where we have been cleaning our own streets for months because the council are refusing to. They are felling the tres up and down Winchmore Hill roads, They are plastering layers of signs up and down our trees - most of which now lie across the floor and are felling perfectly healthy trees. No tree on hoppers road needs a cut. It is again targeted for destruction. I have taken before photos and had an arborist carry out inspection reports to vouch for their good health. The road is not being maintained and is filthy. I clean every day and pick up waste from the bin they refuse to empty and bring it home. There are rats up and down Grovelands park where the bins are never emptied and the bin on church hill outside the lark stinks and is never emptied. It has been months since church hill has been cleaned by the council. We are cleaning it to support a very upset vicar who sees the council refusing to clean outside our place of worship. Bury street and now dunholme road - reported on social media by the council leader as being cleaned and bury street and Southgate town centre are cleaned a few times each week. A senior councillor lives on bury street so the chief executive needs to see why dunhome road is being cleaned. My own road is cleaned by neighbours - never the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Around half a dozen street lamps, 2nd December
item.description:
Around half a dozen street lamps are out between starbucks and the top of norman road They have been out for weeks that corner of the park is dangerously unlit You cannot see the ground you are walking on late at night Please fix this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
